text: <a href="../1-Timothy-3-1/" title="1 Timothy 3:1 KJV verse detail"><span id="3" class="versehover">1 This *is* a true saying, If a man desire the office of a bishop, he desireth a good work.

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-2/" title="1 Timothy 3:2 KJV verse detail"><span id="4" class="versehover">2 A bishop then must be blameless, the husband of one wife, vigilant, sober, of good behaviour, given to hospitality, apt to teach;

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-3/" title="1 Timothy 3:3 KJV verse detail"><span id="5" class="versehover">3 Not given to wine, no striker, not greedy of filthy lucre; but patient, not a brawler, not covetous;
<a href="../1-Timothy-3-4/" title="1 Timothy 3:4 KJV verse detail"><span id="6" class="versehover">4 One that ruleth well his own house, having his children in subjection with all gravity;
<a href="../1-Timothy-3-5/" title="1 Timothy 3:5 KJV verse detail"><span id="7" class="versehover">5 (For if a man know not how to rule his own house, how shall he take care of the church of God?)
<a href="../1-Timothy-3-6/" title="1 Timothy 3:6 KJV verse detail"><span id="8" class="versehover">6 Not a novice, lest being lifted up with pride he fall into the condemnation of the devil.

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-7/" title="1 Timothy 3:7 KJV verse detail"><span id="9" class="versehover">7 Moreover he must have a good report of them which are without; lest he fall into reproach and the snare of the devil.

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-8/" title="1 Timothy 3:8 KJV verse detail"><span id="10" class="versehover">8 Likewise *must* the deacons *be* grave, not doubletongued, not given to much wine, not greedy of filthy lucre;
<a href="../1-Timothy-3-9/" title="1 Timothy 3:9 KJV verse detail"><span id="11" class="versehover">9 Holding the mystery of the faith in a pure conscience.

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-10/" title="1 Timothy 3:10 KJV verse detail"><span id="12" class="versehover">10 And let these also first be proved; then let them use the office of a deacon, being *found* blameless.
<a href="../1-Timothy-3-11/" title="1 Timothy 3:11 KJV verse detail"><span id="13" class="versehover">11 Even so *must their* wives *be* grave, not slanderers, sober, faithful in all things.
<a href="../1-Timothy-3-12/" title="1 Timothy 3:12 KJV verse detail"><span id="14" class="versehover">12 Let the deacons be the husbands of one wife, ruling their children and their own houses well.

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-13/" title="1 Timothy 3:13 KJV verse detail"><span id="15" class="versehover">13 For they that have used the office of a deacon well purchase to themselves a good degree, and great boldness in the faith which is in Christ Jesus.
<a href="../1-Timothy-3-14/" title="1 Timothy 3:14 KJV verse detail"><span id="16" class="versehover">14 These things write I unto thee, hoping to come unto thee shortly:

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-15/" title="1 Timothy 3:15 KJV verse detail"><span id="17" class="versehover">15 But if I tarry long, that thou mayest know how thou oughtest to behave thyself in the house of God, which is the church of the living God, the pillar and ground of the truth.

<a href="../1-Timothy-3-16/" title="1 Timothy 3:16 KJV verse detail"><span id="18" class="versehover">16 And without controversy great is the mystery of godliness: God was manifest in the flesh, justified in the Spirit, seen of angels, preached unto the Gentiles, believed on in the world, received up into glory.
